citeinfo.origin: People's Republic of China, State Oceanic Administration (SOA)
citeinfo.title: Ocean Station Data in China Real Time Data Base (RTDB) for NEAR-GOOS

abstract.p: Data observed on forteen ocean stations, ie. Xiaochangshang , Laohutan , Zhifudao , Xiaomaidao , Lianyungang , Lvsi , Shengshan , Zhenhai , Dachen , Nanlu , Beishuang , Xiamen , Dongshan, and Zhelang at 00:00 , 06:00 and 12:00 per day (no data at 18:00 , UTC). Observed data include visibility, air temperature, wind direction, wind seped, pressure, precipitation, sea temperature, wave period, and wave height.

There are two kind of data file , ie. Ocean data and Global Telecommunication System (GTS) data. They are named based on the following method: Datakind_DD , Datakind means kind of data , DD means date.
Data can be downloaded from the China Real Time Data Base for NEAR-GOOS. First time user must register.

descript.purpose: To offer basic data service to NEAR-GOOS and GOOS communities as part of the NEAR-GOOS project.

idinfo.accconst: First time users must register to gain database access.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.

metainfo.metstdn: Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
metainfo.metac: First time users must register to gain database access.
